snippet: Expensive, partisan state judicial elections are tarnishing the integrity of American justice.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the choosing of judges in partisan elections, rather than through a system of merit selection; contends requiring judges to cozy up to party leaders and raise large sums from special interests eager to influence their decisions seriously damages the efficacy and credibility of the American judiciary.
lead_paragraph: Expensive, partisan state judicial elections are tarnishing the integrity of American justice.
